item.title: Bangladesh National Among 8 Arrested For Plan To Target RSS, Hindu Groups, Says Assam STF - NDTV
item.description:
Bangladesh National Among 8 Arrested for Plot to Target RSS, Hindu Groups, Says Assam STF

Date & Source: December 19, 2024, NDTV

The Assam Police's Special Task Force (STF) arrested eight terror suspects, including a Bangladesh national, for a plot to target RSS and Hindu groups.

  1. A Bangladesh national, Md Sad Radi, was among the eight terror suspects arrested by the Assam STF.
  2. The suspects were part of an Al-Qaeda affiliate in the Indian subcontinent and had plans to activate sleeper cells in Assam and West Bengal.
  3. The arrests were part of 'Operation Praghat,' conducted with the help of police in Kerala and Bengal.
  4. The suspects planned violent activities, assassinations, and efforts to disrupt communal harmony.
"It's a major move against jihadi elements. The fact that we could nip this in the bud with the help of central agencies, and with the West Bengal and Kerala Police. I'd call it a success when we get more. But yes, we have made a beginning." - Assam Special DGP Harmeet Singh

The arrests highlight the efforts to curb terrorist activities and maintain stability in the region.

item.title: Russia set for a missile duel with US, says president Vladimir Putin - The Times of India
item.description:
Russia set for a missile duel with US, says president Vladimir Putin

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

In a recent statement, President Vladimir Putin announced that Russia is prepared for a potential missile confrontation with the United States amidst escalating tensions between the two nations.

  • Putin emphasized Russia's military readiness.
  • The announcement comes as relations between Russia and the US further deteriorate.
  • Discussions about missile capabilities have intensified in both countries.
“We are ready to meet any threat,” said Putin during a press conference.

This declaration raises concerns about the implications of heightened military readiness and the possibility of conflict between the two powers.

item.title: Amid 'Injury vs Injury' Row In Parliament, Big Charge By Congress Women MPs - NDTV
item.description:
Amid 'Injury vs Injury' Row In Parliament, Big Charge By Congress Women MPs

Date: December 19, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The ongoing protest between Congress and BJP escalated with Women MPs from Congress accusing BJP MPs of physical assault during a parliamentary session sparked by comments made by Home Minister Amit Shah.

  • The Congress party accused BJP MPs of dishonoring their women leaders.
  • BJP MP Phangnon Konyak alleged that Rahul Gandhi misbehaved during the protest.
  • Parliament witnessed chaotic scenes with injuries reported among BJP MPs.
  • Congress demands serious action against BJP MPs involved in the incident.
“Their conduct was not only a blatant assault on the personal dignity of Rahul Gandhi but antithetical to the democratic spirit of our parliament.” - Congress Statement

The exchanges have intensified, highlighting the ongoing political rivalry as protests ensue over Mr. Shah's controversial remarks regarding Dr. Ambedkar.

item.title: Stock market crash today: BSE Sensex ends 964 points down; Nifty50 below 24,000 - The Times of India
item.description:
Stock market crash today: BSE Sensex ends 964 points down; Nifty50 below 24,000

Date: (Insert Date Here) Source: Times of India

Today, the Indian stock market experienced a significant downturn, with the BSE Sensex closing 964 points lower and the Nifty50 falling below the crucial level of 24,000.

  • The BSE Sensex closed 964 points down, marking one of the largest daily drops this year.
  • Nifty50 dipped below the 24,000 mark for the first time in recent months.
  • Market analysts cite macroeconomic instability and rising inflation as key factors behind the crash.
  • Brokers report a wave of panic selling among retail investors contributing to the sharp decline.
“This is a wake-up call for investors to reassess their portfolios amid growing economic concerns,” said a market analyst.

The downturn in the stock market raises concerns over the economic outlook as investors brace for potential further volatility in the coming days.

item.title: People Seeking Justice For Atul Subhash Chase Rahul Gandhi. He Does This - NDTV
item.description:
Activists Chase Rahul Gandhi for Justice for Atul Subhash

Publication Date: December 19, 2024 Source: NDTV

A group of activists demanding justice for techie Atul Subhash chased Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's cavalcade on the streets of Delhi. Their efforts were aimed at raising awareness of Atul's tragic suicide and the need for accountability regarding alleged harassment faced by him.

  • Atul Subhash died by suicide on December 9 after alleging harassment from his estranged wife and her family.
  • Activists argue that laws meant to protect women are being misused against men.
  • Despite the public interest, no political leader has addressed this issue until now.
  • Ms. Deepika Narayan Bhardwaj, a lawyer-activist, has been vocal about the misuse of anti-dowry laws.
  • Rahul Gandhi engaged briefly with the activists during the chase, throwing a chocolate to them.
No Parliamentarian has spoken about tragic suicide by #AtulSubhash and the reasons behind suicides by so many men in India. — Deepika Narayan Bhardwaj

The incident underscores the activists' urgent plea for justice and the hope that it will prompt political action on these critical issues affecting many individuals in society.

item.title: What makes 'khajoor' a winter special? 5 reasons to eat dates in this season - India.com
item.description:
What makes 'khajoor' a winter special? 5 reasons to eat dates in this season

Published Date: Not specified Source: India.com

Khajoor, or dates, are often considered a winter delicacy in many cultures, particularly in regions where they are harvested during the cooler months. Here are five compelling reasons to enjoy dates during this season:

5 Benefits of Dates in Winter

  1. Nutrient-Rich Energy Boost: Dates are packed with essential nutrients, making them an excellent source of energy.
  2. Rich in Antioxidants: Dates are rich in antioxidants that help combat oxidative stress in the body.
  3. Warmth and Comfort: Traditionally used in winter recipes, dates contribute warmth and comfort.
  4. Bone Health: Dates contain minerals essential for maintaining strong bones.
  5. Natural Sweetener for Healthy Treats: Dates serve as a healthier alternative to refined sugars in festive sweets.

Khajoor is not just a delicious winter treat; it offers numerous health benefits that can enhance your seasonal diet.

item.title: Sensex fell 1,000 points on Thursday but these stocks ended at a record high - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Sensex Falls 1,000 Points, Yet Certain Stocks Reach Record Highs

Publication Date: Thursday
Source: CNBC TV18

The Sensex experienced a sharp decline, falling nearly 1,000 points, yet several stocks managed to end the day at record highs.

  • Despite the decline in the Sensex, Kfin Tech shares rose 7.6% to a record high, supported by a positive rating from Jefferies.
  • Oracle Financial Services saw a 4.5% increase, recovering from earlier lows.
  • Mankind Pharma was highlighted as a standout in the pharmaceutical sector, gaining 45% in 2024.
  • The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) stock doubled in value over six months, nearing ₹6,000.
  • Persistent Systems rose 2%, marking an 80% increase for the year.
“The stock has nearly tripled in value in 2024 so far, with gains of 196%.”

Despite the overall market being weak, these stocks showed resilience, illustrating the disparity in market performance across sectors.

item.title: R Ashwin's Father's Shocking Revelation On Son's Retirement: "Humiliation..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
R Ashwin's Father's Shocking Revelation on Son's Retirement

Publication Date: Not specified Source: News 18

The recent retirement of Indian cricket star Ravichandran Ashwin has surprised his fans and family alike. His father suggested that feelings of 'humiliation' may have influenced Ashwin's sudden decision to retire from international cricket.

  • Ashwin returned home from Australia after announcing his retirement.
  • His father mentioned they were also shocked by the news.
  • There are claims that humiliation contributed to Ashwin’s decision.
  • Ashwin was one of the top wicket-takers for India in international cricket.
  • He only played in one pink-ball Test during the recent series.
“What was going on in his mind I don't know. He just announced. I too accepted it with full pleasure.” - Ashwin's father

This retirement marks a significant change after a long and successful career, leaving many to speculate about the reasons behind his quick departure from the sport.

item.title: 'You can't film without asking me': Irritated Virat Kohli on arriving at Melbourne Airport - The Times of India
item.description:
Virat Kohli Expresses Frustration with Media at Melbourne Airport

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Times of India

Indian cricketer Virat Kohli arrived in Melbourne for the Boxing Day Test and had a tense exchange with the media regarding their filming practices.

  • Kohli was irritated over perceived filming of his family at the airport.
  • A Channel 7 reporter clarified that the situation arose from a misunderstanding.
  • Kohli emphasized his need for privacy concerning his children, stating, “With my kids I need some privacy, you can’t film without asking me.”
  • The misunderstanding was resolved when it was confirmed that his children were not being filmed.
  • Kohli's recent performance has been mixed, scoring a century in the first Test but only 26 runs in his other innings.
  • The Border-Gavaskar series is tied 1-1 going into the fourth Test at the MCG.
“It was upon seeing the waiting cameras that Kohli became a little heated over what is largely a misunderstanding when he thought the media was filming him with his children,” reported Channel 7.

The incident highlights ongoing tensions between celebrities and media privacy norms.

item.title: Starbucks is not exiting India: Tata Consumer denies ‘baseless’ report of coffee chain quitting country - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Starbucks is not exiting India: Tata Consumer denies ‘baseless’ report of coffee chain quitting country

Date: Dec 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Tata Consumer Products has officially denied claims suggesting that American coffee chain Starbucks might exit India due to financial struggles and rising costs, labeling the report as 'baseless.'

  • Tata Consumer Products labeled recent reports about Starbucks' potential exit from India as untrue.
  • A Rajasthan-based media outlet published the original claim, sparking concerns over Starbucks' operations in the country.
  • Despite reported losses, Tata maintains a strong partnership with Starbucks.
  • Tata's CEO mentioned a delay in new store openings amid declining customer footfall.
"Reports of Starbucks looking to exit India (are) completely false and baseless. Tata’s relationship with Starbucks stands strong with shared values and commitment to India." - Tata Consumer Products

This clarification serves to reassure stakeholders that Starbucks remains committed to its Indian market, despite challenges.

item.title: CAT Result 2024 LIVE Updates: When is IIM CAT 2024 score card releasing at iimcat.ac.in? - The Indian Express
item.description:
CAT Result 2024 LIVE Updates: IIM Sambalpur exits CAP 2025; results awaited at iimcat.ac.in

Date: December 4, 2024

Source: Indian Express

The Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Calcutta has released the final answer keys for the Common Admission Test (CAT) 2024. The results are still awaited and can be released at any time soon.

  • 3.29 lakh candidates registered for the CAT exam.
  • 2.93 lakh candidates appeared for the exam, leading to an overall attendance of approximately 89%.
  • This year's exam is believed to be easier compared to the last two years.
  • The expected higher cut-off may affect admission chances.
  • Registration for PG programmes at IIMs and other colleges will be based on the CAT 2024 scores.
"The IIM-CAT exam results will be determined through a normalisation process that considers multiple factors."

Overall, anticipation for the CAT 2024 results continues to build, with candidates eager to proceed to their respective postgraduate programs based on the scores.

item.title: 'Gundagardi karte ho?' What happened when Rahul Gandhi approached injured BJP MP Sarangi; watch video - The Times of India
item.description:
'Gundagardi karte ho?' Rahul Gandhi Approaches Injured BJP MP Sarangi

Publication Date: Date not specified | Source: Times of India

In a recent incident, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi approached injured BJP MP Sarangi, raising questions about political decency and respect for rivals.

  • Rahul Gandhi's unexpected visit to BJP MP Sarangi.
  • The interaction sparked a debate on political conduct.
  • Gandhi's remarks included, 'Gundagardi karte ho?'
“We must maintain dignity even in political rivalry,” said Gandhi during the interaction.

This incident highlights the need for civility in political discourse, regardless of party lines.

item.title: Virat Kohli involved in heated argument with Australian TV journalist: 'I need privacy with my kids. You just can't...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli Involves in Tense Exchange with Australian Journalist Over Children’s Privacy

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Virat Kohli had a heated argument with an Australian TV journalist at Melbourne airport as he felt his children were being filmed without consent. The former captain is known for being protective of his family.

  • Kohli became upset upon realizing video cameras pointed at his children.
  • He confronted the journalist, stating, "With my kids I need some privacy, you just can't film without asking me."
  • The situation was later clarified, and Kohli shook hands with the involved cameraperson.
  • His performance has been a concern in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy, where he's struggled apart from a century.
“It was upon seeing the waiting cameras that Kohli became a little heated...” – Theo Doropoulos, Channel 7 Reporter

The Border-Gavaskar Trophy series is currently tied 1-1, with the next match scheduled for December 26.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE: Govinda’s son, Yashvardhan Ahuja set for acting debut in a love story directed by National Award Winner, Sai Rajesh - PINKVILLA
item.description:
EXCLUSIVE: Govinda’s son, Yashvardhan Ahuja set for acting debut in a love story directed by National Award Winner, Sai Rajesh

Published on Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Pinkvilla

Yashvardhan Ahuja, the son of the legendary actor Govinda, is set to make his debut in a yet untitled love story directed by National Award winner Sai Rajesh, scheduled to begin filming in 2025. This marks the continuation of Govinda's cinematic legacy through his son.

  • Yashvardhan has auditioned and secured his role in the film based on merit.
  • The film aims to create a unique love story with original music to enhance the narrative.
  • A nationwide search for the female lead is ongoing, with over 14,000 audition clips submitted so far.
  • Producers are looking to begin filming by summer 2025.
“The yet untitled love story will bring the second generation of Govinda’s legacy to the big screen,” revealed a source.

This film not only represents a new chapter for Yashvardhan but also a continuation of his father's impactful career in Indian cinema.

item.title: Who is Pratap Sarangi, BJP MP in ICU after scuffle at Parliament today? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Who is Pratap Sarangi, BJP MP in ICU after scuffle at Parliament today?

Publication Date: December 19, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Protests erupted in Parliament following remarks by Home Minister Amit Shah, leading to injuries of two BJP MPs, including Pratap Sarangi.

  • Violent protests occurred due to Amit Shah's comments on Ambedkar.
  • MPs Pratap Sarangi and Mukesh Rajput were hospitalized in ICU with severe injuries.
  • Opposition MPs staged protests demanding an apology from Amit Shah.
“Two MPs Pratap Sarangi and Mukesh Rajput are hospitalised at RML. The two are currently in ICU at the hospital.” - RML spokesperson Ajay Shukla

The incident highlights ongoing tensions in Indian politics, particularly regarding the opposition's reactions to government statements.

item.title: Ambedkar row: Parliament in chaos as Rahul's alleged push sends BJP MPs to ICU; Kharge says I was pushed too - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parliament Erupts in Chaos Over Rahul Gandhi's Alleged Push, BJP MPs Injured

Published on: No date provided Source: Hindustan Times

The ongoing political crisis in Indian Parliament escalated dramatically as Congress MP Rahul Gandhi allegedly pushed BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi, resulting in significant injuries and drawing widespread media attention.

  • Rahul Gandhi and other opposition MPs protested on the Makar Dwar, demanding an apology from Home Minister Amit Shah for controversial remarks about BR Ambedkar.
  • Two BJP MPs were hospitalized in ICU following the alleged incident, raising questions about parliamentary decorum.
  • Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge claimed he was also pushed during the melee.
  • Amit Shah's comments on BR Ambedkar have sparked outrage, leading to intensified protests from the opposition.
“Rahul Gandhi pushed an MP who fell on me after which I fell down...” - BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi

The incident has opened a broader debate about the safety and decorum within the parliament, and further escalated tensions between ruling and opposition parties.

item.title: OpenAI Introduces New Phone Number for ChatGPT, Lets Users Access Chatbot via Phone Calls and WhatsApp - Gadgets 360
item.description:
You Can Now Call and Send WhatsApp Texts to ChatGPT

Publication Date: Wednesday | Source: Gadgets360

OpenAI introduced an official phone number for ChatGPT, allowing eligible users to make voice calls and send WhatsApp texts to interact with the AI chatbot.

  • Users in Canada and the US can call a toll-free number (1-800-ChatGPT).
  • Voice call time is currently limited to 15 minutes per month.
  • Users outside of North America can communicate via WhatsApp only.
  • WhatsApp interactions currently only support text and lack features such as image generation or advanced tools.
  • The service works on both smartphones and feature phones.
“OpenAI has been aggressively pushing to make ChatGPT the default AI chatbot platform for people.”

This initiative targets users in rural areas with limited data access or those new to chatbots, while OpenAI continues to expand its influence in the AI market.
